title: Skilled — Designated Area Sponsored visa (subclass 496)
summary: This page provides information about the now‑closed Skilled — Designated Area Sponsored visa (subclass 496). It outlines what current visa holders and their families can do, how long the visa lasts, obligations, and what changes must be reported. It also suggests available alternative visas for eligible family members.

visa_details.validity_period: 4 years after first entry to Australia

skilled_regional_provisional_subclass_48.description: Family unit members might be able to apply if the primary holder already possesses a subclass 496 visa and they want to join them in Australia.

applicant_information.contact_for_updates: Adelaide General Skilled Migration (GSM) processing centre

visa_holders_information.vevo_access: Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO) can be used for free to check visa details and entitlements.

allowed_actions: Become eligible to apply for permanent residence
Travel to and from Australia any number of times while the visa is valid

change_notification_requirements.consequences_of_not_reporting_passport_c: Significant delays at the airport and potential denial of permission to board a plane.
